intro: Diploclinium biloculare, commonly known as the two-celled diploclinium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
